posts.title: Welcome to Mini Blog
posts.excerpt: This is the first demo post — a quick welcome and explanation of how this static blog works.
posts.content_html:
Welcome! This static blog uses a local posts.json file as its database. Each post is stored as JSON and rendered by script.js. This approach keeps everything local and perfect for GitHub Pages.

How it works

  • Open index.html to see the list of posts.
  • Click a post to open post.html?slug=....
  • No server required — GitHub Pages or any static host will work.

Enjoy experimenting!

posts.title: How to Extend This Setup
posts.excerpt: Ideas to extend the static blog: add tags, pagination, markdown compilation, or CI to generate posts.
posts.content_html:
Here are a few ways to improve this tiny blog:

  1. Markdown support: pre-compile markdown to HTML in your CI or locally and store the HTML in posts.json.
  2. Tag filters: add a tag cloud and filter by tag on the client side.
  3. Comments: integrate a static commenting solution (e.g. GitHub Issues, staticman) or use a short JSON file for approved comments.
  4. Search: for bigger sites, use a tiny prebuilt index (lunr) exported during build.

Because the content is stored in JSON, you can also write simple scripts to add new posts programmatically.
